stimulusHtml: Let f be a function having derivatives of all orders for x > 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyOpa4JaaGimaaaa@3BBA@ such that f ( 3 ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E2D@ , f ′ ( 3 ) = − 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F25@ , f ″ ( 3 ) = 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EF5@ , and f ‴ ( 3 ) = 12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F01@ . Which of the following is the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f about x = 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BBB@ ?
choicesHtml: 2 − x + 6 x 2 + 12 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43D1@

2 − x + 3 x 2 + 2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4313@

2 − ( x − 3 ) + 6 ( x − 3 ) 2 + 12 ( x − 3 ) 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DC7@

2 − ( x − 3 ) + 3 ( x − 3 ) 2 + 4 ( x − 3 ) 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D0B@

2 − ( x − 3 ) + 3 ( x − 3 ) 2 + 2 ( x − 3 ) 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D09@
